description: Ms. codex. Title from fol. 1a (damaged) and 28b. 17 to 19 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Thick light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. The quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals in the form "thānīyah" (see fol. 11a). The second text is foliated using Arabic numerals in black ink. Copied by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Qādirī. Text 1 completed on 11 Ṣafar 891(?, Mach, R. Yahuda) [Feb. 16, 1486](colophon, fol. 26b).
author: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505
abstract: Collection of two treatises by Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī on the properties of Friday and on death. There is a table of contents of the second text on fol. 127a-b.
contents: 1. fol. 1a-26b: [Nūr al-lumʻah] fī khuṣūṣīyat yawm al-Jumʻah / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
2. fol. 28b-187b: Sharḥ al-ṣudūr bi-sharḥ ḥāl al-mawt wa-al-qubūr [incomplete at end] / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
extent: 190 leaves: paper ; 186 x 135 (138 x 95) mm. bound to 186 x 135 mm.

title.@value: نور اللمعة في خصوصية يوم الجمعة ؛ شرح الصدور بشرح حال الموت والقبور
Nūr al-lumʻah fī khuṣūṣīyat yawm al-Jumʻah ; Sharḥ al-ṣudūr bi-sharḥ ḥāl al-mawt wa-al-qubūr.

provenance: Two obliterated ownership statements on fol. 1a, one dated 10-7 H. the other with a seal dated 1088 H. [1677 or 8]. Ownership statement signed Abū al-Wafā Ibn Aḥmad al-Kawākibī (or: Kawākī) on fol. 26b, 28a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
